actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 105-91.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 31.
Mr. Kim moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with fortyr minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Economic Development

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the sixteenth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

summary.text: Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a public event, the 16th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 1997.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol grounds for the sixteenth annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.
